subject: Technology
title: Space Invaders and the Arcade Boom
description: A quick, practical guide to Space Invaders and the Arcade Boom.

hook.text: In 1978, Space Invaders caused a coin shortage in Japan. The government had to mint more 100-yen coins.

buildup.text: Rows of aliens marched down the screen. The player's lone ship was humanity's last defense.

discovery.text: As you shot aliens, the remaining ones moved faster. The game got harder the better you played.

twist.text: That increasing speed was actually a hardware limitation. Fewer sprites meant the processor ran faster.

climax.text: Space Invaders turned arcades into social destinations. Teenagers lined up for hours to play.

punchline.text: A hardware bug became gaming's first brilliant difficulty curve.

quiz.question: Why did aliens in Space Invaders speed up as you destroyed them?
options: It was a deliberate design choice
Fewer sprites let the processor run faster
